src:
Kemenlu RI: WNI Wafat di KBRI Kuala Lumpur Idap Penyakit Jantung
01 Nov 2019, 15:19 by Retno M


Kemenlu RI: WNI Wafat di KBRI Kuala Lumpur Idap Penyakit Jantung

KBRN, Jakarta : Kementerian luar negeri RI menyampaikan rasa duka cita atas berpulangnya Â seorang warga negara Indonesia (WNI) bernama Tamam. Almarhum sedang berada di depan kedutaan besar RI (KBRI) Kuala Lumpur untuk pengambilan nomor layanan pembuatan paspor, pada Kamis (31/10/2019).
Jumat (1/11/2019), dalam keterangan tulis direktur perlindungan WNI dan badan hukum Indonesia (PWNI dan BHI) kementerian luar negeri RI, Judha Nugraha, menyatakan, saat antrian belum terlalu banyak, almarhum tiba-tiba tidak sadarkan diri dan kemudian meninggal dunia.
Lebih lanjut Judha menambahkan, KBRI segera menghubungi polisi setempat dan keluarga. Dari informasi pihak keluarga, almarhum memang telah lama mengidap sakit jantung.
Judha menuturkan, berdasarkan data rekam medis yang disampaikan keluarga, polisi tidak melakukan otopsi dan jenazah telah diserahkan kepada keluarga. KBRI Kuala Lumpur membantu keluarga untuk pengurusan jenazah.
Sementara, almarhum Tamam dan istri adalah permanent resident di Malaysia, memiliki 3 anak yang telah berkewarganegaraan Malaysia. Jenazah almarhum telah dimakamkan di Pemakaman Islam Kuang, Sungai Buloh, Selangor, Malaysia.
text:
RI Ministry of Foreign Affairs: Indonesian Citizen dies at the Indonesian Embassy in Kuala Lumpur Idap Heart Disease
Nov 1 2019, 15:19 by Retno M


RI Ministry of Foreign Affairs: Indonesian Citizen dies at the Indonesian Embassy in Kuala Lumpur Idap Heart Disease

KBRN, Jakarta: The Indonesian Ministry of Foreign Affairs expressed grief over the passing of an Indonesian citizen named Tamam. The deceased was in front of the Indonesian embassy (KBRI) in Kuala Lumpur to collect passport-making service numbers, on Thursday (10/31/2019).
Friday (1/11/2019), in a written statement of the director of Indonesian citizen protection and Indonesian legal entities (PWNI and BHI) the Indonesian foreign ministry, Judha Nugraha, stated, when the queue was not too many, the deceased suddenly collapsed and then died world.
Furthermore Judha added, the Indonesian Embassy immediately contacted the local police and family. From the information of the family, the deceased indeed had a long time suffering from heart disease.
Judha said, based on medical record data submitted by the family, the police did not do an autopsy and the body had been handed over to the family. The Indonesian Embassy in Kuala Lumpur helps families to arrange the body.
Meanwhile, the late Tamam and his wife are permanent residents in Malaysia, with 3 children who are citizens of Malaysia. The deceased's body was buried in the Kuang Islamic Cemetery, Sungai Buloh, Selangor, Malaysia.
